data: If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 9 steps left. Take 10 steps forward. Take 9 steps right. Take 10 steps backward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

If you always face forward, you can assume the direction of the direction you're going. You also are able to assume the direction if you can predict the direction from your point of view. The right & forward directions are where you are facing toward from. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Four steps, turn around and turn right. So, the answer is yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 6 steps. Take 4 steps. Turn around. Take 10 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
You cannot turn around and start again at the same point. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 7 steps. Take 1 step. Take 7 steps. Turn left. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
No it doesn’ t. Take 7 steps and turn right. Take 1 step and turn left. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 10 steps. Turn left. Turn left. Take 9 steps. Take 3 steps. Take 3 steps. Turn around. Take 5 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

The first order is 1st to left, and the second order is 2nd to right. If you go back to the starting point, you take 3 steps on the first order of movement. If you go back to the starting point, then take 10 more steps on the next order of movement then on the previous order on the first. Thus, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Turn left. Turn right. Take 7 steps. Turn around. Take 7 steps. Turn right. Turn left. Turn right. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
Turn right. Turn around. Turn around. Turn left. Turn right. Yes. So, the answer is No.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 8 steps. Take 9 steps. Turn right. Turn right. Take 8 steps. Take 9 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.

The start is left and a few seconds after stepping on right, the start is up a stairway. To quickly return to the starting point, you start moving the stairs and then turn right. So, the answer is Yes.
If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Take 6 steps. Turn around. Take 8 steps. Take 2 steps. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
If you turn around and take 6 steps, you return to your starting point with 8 steps. If you take 2 steps, you return to the starting point with 2 steps. So, the answer is Yes.

If you follow these instructions, do you return to the starting point? Always face forward. Take 1 step left. Take 4 steps forward. Take 6 steps forward. Options: - Yes - No Let’ s think step by step.
You may start a movement in one direction only, with 1 step left, and return to start in another direction. The fact that you always face forward is part of how you go forward. So, the answer is yes.

If we take 9 steps in the first direction, then we take 9 steps in the opposite direction. Taking 2 steps is a different direction. Thus, the answer is No.

Take 1 step backward gives you 3 steps forward. Take 1 step backward gives 1 step backward. So, the answer is Yes.

To start moving forward, face forward. To do the steps listed above, you should always do a forward motion, always facing forward. So, the answer is Yes.

If you have 6 steps left and 3 steps left, you will take 6 steps right. The answer: Yes.

The final answer: yes.

A person always lies facing forward. Everybody always starts with a straight forward, left facing person. The person on the left side is always facing forward. They don’ t take a step backward. The other person is facing right. So the answer is yes.

After taking 8 steps, you will return to the starting point. The instructions indicate that you must take 8 steps. So, the answer is No.

The starting point of the route is the 10 steps to the right of where you started. The starting point of the route is the 6 steps to the right of where you left off. So, the answer is No.

Take two steps towards the starting point. Take two steps towards the starting point. Doing the following: Take seven steps. Take two steps towards the starting point. Doing the following: Take nine steps. Doing the following: Take ten steps. Doing the following: Take fifteen steps.

You take 14 steps back to the beginning step. Then you turn around and take 2 steps. If you turn around and return to the starting point, after taking 9 steps, you’ll be returned to the starting point. So, the answer is no.

If you turn right, the direction changes. If you turn right, the direction changes again. So, the answer is yes.

In the first order the beginning is x and then in the second order it is y. The first order of steps begins on left and the second does the same on left. So, the answer is yes.

If you take 3 steps and turn around you are back at the starting point. If you take 2 steps and take 2 steps and twist around you are back at the starting point. You need either 10 or 10 = 2 steps to get to your starting point. So, the answer is no.

This process takes one person 7 steps back. That will bring you to the starting point. So, the answer is No.

You always take 5 steps backward. It is in order to turn left. The correct order is: left; 7; 8; 4; 3; 5. So, the answer is No.

Each time you take 8 steps backward, you go back 9 steps. The first time you take 9 steps left, you take 5 steps backward. So, the answer is Yes.

If the starting point is outside, you can never be right back there. So, the answer is yes.

If the starting point faces forward, following the directions, there should be no problems on where to go, the starting point being the starting point and the next step being taken. So, the answer is Yes.

Turn right and take 5 steps back up to the exit. Turn right and take 5 steps back and turn around. So, the answer is No.

Take 2 steps backward. The way to avoid repeating a direction over and over is to always look forward. Take 3 steps backward. The way to avoid repeating a direction over and over is to always look backward. Take 8 steps forward. So, the answer is Yes.

Let's consider the first sentence of the first step phrase. The first sentence of the sentence takes no steps. The next sentence of the sentence takes the same amount of steps as the first sentence. So, the answer is Yes.

If someone always faces forward, after you follow a certain instruction, the starting point would be facing forward. You cannot turn around without facing forward. So, the answer is No.

When you face forward, your feet hit the ground and move like normal. If you take 6 steps forward, the foot touches the ground. If you take 4 steps forward, the foot lands on the ground. When you take 6 steps backward, you hit the ground. So, the answer is no.

Each of the steps to reversing is a step backward. Since all of the steps to reversing are backwards, this reversal leads to a right turn. If you always face forward, you are always forward facing. Taking 2 steps backwards returns you to being out in the open. Taking 4 steps backwards reverts you to being back in the open. So, the answer is No.

If people always face forward, then they will not go back to where they started. If someone takes 2 steps backward, then they are not going to come back until they take 4 steps backward as the instructions state that they take. So, the answer is no.

Turn around is another term for turn back. When you turn around the direction of travel is the same. So, the answer is yes.

Face forward to begin. Take 4 steps to the left and one step back.

If you take 9 steps forward you return to the starting point. If you take 5 steps right then you always face forward. If you take 2 steps left then you always face left. If you take 1 step forward then you always place yourself in the starting point. A person who always faces forward will always place themselves in the starting point. Thus, the answer is Yes.

When you first begin, keep your eyes towards the right, your feet slightly to the left, and your body in the forward motion. The only direction you should not be facing is right. So, the answer is No.

To turn right, you should turn left, take 9 steps, take 3 steps and turn right. If you follow the instructions correctly, it is impossible to get back to your starting point. So, the answer is No.

When you' reversing, don' t take the 6 steps straight to the right, just the 5 steps left. Taking the 9 steps left to the right can mean you' reversing twice as fast, so the correct answer is yes.
